WRITING.TITLE: Is What I Experienced Psychosis?
WRITING.TEXT: So.. it's been 4 months since I've been showing all the symptoms of Schizophrenia, along with depression and as a past self Harmer, I can't say I am not tempted to do so again. I have bizarre delusions and scary hallucinations, all three types common in schizophrenia, which is auditory, visual, and tactile. This happened a 2 weeks ago.. so I was chilling and it was like 12:30 am or something (yeah I'm a bit of a night owl) and I have a habit to stroll around my house to burn some extra calories while not being outside as ya know.. self Quarantine. As I was walking, I started becoming extremely paranoid that someone is watching me(I always feel this but this time it was.. intense to say the least) and my hallucinations were getting really creepy, like shadow figures with scary faces and eyes creepy. And then my "delusion" that nothing's actually real and everything is just in my head and I'm just a psych ward patient in some mental institution, and am basically, crazy as hell. When I am having these types of "episodes" I usually internalize it and don't show my emotions. So like.. I had a blank face during all this. And then I felt a numb yet sharp pain around my left temporal bone of my skull and felt like someone was messing with my brain, or put a chip in me to reprogram me. This lasted for 2 and a half days and it was hell. I still everynight feel this temporal bone thingy and now I also feel like someone has been messing with my internal organs while I'm in "this world". Was this extreme bouts of paranoia, delusions and hallucinations, and I forgot to mention the voices in my head telling me to kill myself, was this psychosis? P.S. sorry for rambling on too much
Oh.. ok
Thanks

But at the same time, posts like "oh iM sO qIrKy iM dePrESsed", are stupid. It's not a thing to be proud about, and not something to be ashamed as well. It shouldn't define you. And the fact that you feel it's fake, think of it through their perspective as well.. they must feel everything is also almost fake like why is this happening to me so I understand if they post about stuff to further accept what's happening.

I've been working out for more than a year now, decent muscularity, atleast for a 17 year old, and 16% body fat percentage, before was 30% approx. And yes, due to my mental health issues and illnesses, it is affecting my workouts as well. My frequency of working out has significantly decreased, but maintaining muscle is easy, so I don't have a problem with that, and my fat loss progress, I've managed with adjusting my diet. So, if your goal is in general fitness, I'd recommend fixing your diet, or improving I'd it's already healthy, stay hypocaloric, and I'd say walk more, I walk 10 miles everyday personally. If your goal is muscle gain, I'd say somehow you have to manage and hit each muscle group twice a week somehow, minimum 5 sets each time. As for the mental health aspect, I'd say keep progress journals, give yourself positive feedback in front of a mirror, keep mirror selfies time after time to track progress, and think of it as an essential part of life rather than a chore, atleast what I try to do personally.

WRITING.TITLE: Gave into my self harm urges after a year clean
WRITING.TEXT: Everynight is just pain for me, I can't fall asleep, keep hallucinating stuff and keep hearing voices, had an anxiety attack due to what I just saw, and I just couldn't take it anymore. I've been clean for more than a year, but nowadays with my hallucinations, as my mental health deteriorates, my urges were coming back. Tonight, I just couldn't take it anymore. It was either me cutting, or just wanting to die. Every night I suffer and cry myself to sleep, but after cutting I feel so calm and numb at the same time, its scary.. A whole year's progress went to waste.. Needed somewhere to say this as it's eating away at me..
Suffering right now and this made me smile so thanks for that
